attributes.action: clarify the benefits of new emissions taxes - are they designed to raise revenue or reduce rising emissions ?
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
"The Government's "green" road tax system will cost motorists an extra £2 billion but cut vehicle emissions by less than 1%, it has been claimed", AOL today reports.

The environmental benefits of the levies introduced in Alistair Darling's first Budget have been called into question by the Treasury's own figures -please clarify the costs and benefits of this exercise.

Among the measures set out by the Chancellor last month was re-working road duty to punish cars with higher CO2 emissions - the logic of this measure is straight forward, but why then is this not readily accpeted - 

Are all measures - whether everyone will benefit or not ALWAYS used for political capital ? Perhaps cars should emit blue or red smoke ?

Gas-guzzling new cars will also be subject to a special higher rate for the first year - described as a "showroom tax".

The petitioner is calling on the P.M. to include emissions / MOT testing and look at recycled second hand cars.

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
